bug.author: Kipt
bug.summary: sensor_tick property ignored for GNSS, Radar and IMU
bug.description:
After troubleshooting why sensor_tick for IMU didn't change the frequency of the ROS message I noticed the ego_vehicle.py doesn't read the property. This is true for GNSS, radar and IMU sensors. Adding the <denchmark-code>try: bp.set_attribute('sensor_tick', str(sensor_spec['sensor_tick'])) except KeyError: pass </denchmark-code>
snippet fixes the issue.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/joel-mb>@joel-mb</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fpasch>@fpasch</denchmark-link> could you comment on this issue?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Kipt>@Kipt</denchmark-link>
Sorry for the delay. I missed this issue. Could you open a PR in the ros-bridge introducing the fix. Otherwise, I'll do it myself.

Thanks for checking this out <denchmark-link:https://github.com/joel-mb>@joel-mb</denchmark-link>
As the commit I have is based on a ROS-bridge repository that's heavily modified already I think it's faster if you do the change.
